RIP, my friend. 

Hector was a proud union leader. A shrewd political tactician. 

A person of his word at a time where that value has been diminished. And most importantly, a good and decent man. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/12/nyregion/hector-figueroa-union-leader-with-impact-dies-at-57.html?smid=nytcore-ios-share …

The Trump administration isn’t just failing to lead when it comes to the treatment of refugees - the president is failing a moral test. And as a country, we will be judged by our response to the suffering these humans are being forced to endure.

To walk into those facilities, only hours after finding out that CBP officials made sexist, racist, and sexually-charged comments about you, like Reps. @AOC, @RepEscobar, and others did, is incredibly brave.

As a father, as an American, as a person, I am heartbroken over the images & stories from the border. Proud that many of my former colleagues demanded to see the conditions firsthand & are forcing the inhumane treatment of refugees by the Trump admin into the public conscience.
